text:
Recently craving some Pho, I happen to catch Pho Saigon 8 out of the corner of my eye and am I glad I did! 

I first noticed that the business was full, even as people were leaving, it seemed as though all the tables were occupied. The lady who greeted and seated my friend and me was very friendly and welcoming. She had us seated immediately. 

The second thing I noticed was the cleanliness. The tables were quickly wiped clean as people left.  

The menu was extensive and had a good explanation of the various menu items. I chose the beef strip Pho and my friend had the chicken breast Pho. We also had an order of shrimp veggie rolls. All was very tasty and the Pho was plentiful. The beef and the chicken were very tasty, fresh, and juicy. They definitely did not skimp on the amount placed in the bowls. 

I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to my friends and it is definitely going to be my go to when craving Pho!

Order this Bun Bo Hue, soup wasn't as hot! When I added the veggies, the soup got cold!! It was flavorless, all it is SALTY!!!! It didn't come with veggies on the side, we had to ask for it! $9.45 for a small not worth it!

First time trying this place out. Our server rushed us, didn't say anything when he dropped off our food, or check up on us. It's the guy with the hair shaved on the sides of his head and drags his feet everywhere he walks. The only guy who was friendly was the only one not in uniform with a white tshirt, and he's the one who refilled our drinks and asked how we were doing. 
Spring rolls were okay, pho was good. I'll still probably be trying out other pho places until I'm satisfied.
This is an ok place if you need a pho fix. Bill came to $26 for 2 bowls of pho and spring rolls. Not too bad.
Love this location! I don't have to go far to get the best pho in town.  The decor was contemporary, also there are 4 televisions.  The staffs and services were amazing!

This place is on Rainbow just south of 215. If that brings up visions of terrible traffic, you're not alone. If you're coming from the 215 exit, you can sit there several minutes waiting to make the left into the parking lot.

The defining feature of this place, really, is that it's open till 11pm some nights, midnight other nights. So, if it's after about 9:30, this is a great option for some really decent pho. And you don't have to worry about traffic at that hour.

Most of what they make here, while very good, isn't quite as good as some of the other nearby places--but not enough to matter when you're craving some lovely pho. One standout is the chicken pho, which is excellent, and they even let you choose white or dark meat (dark, of course). If you're one of those weird people for whom the normal bowl of pho is too much, they offer a small size.

Service can be spotty. Order by number, as some of the servers don't speak English very well. Don't bother waiting for your check when you're done, just go up to the register and if it's crowded, take note of your table number.

Great option for 11pm takeout.

I just live down the street so I thought I'd check this place out since it's fairly new. I thought the service was great. I was served quickly and was checked on several times throughout my meal. The staff was friendly and the food was yummy. I ordered a small Pho Tai Nam Gau and had more than enough food, the beef was cooked perfectly. Price was competitive with other Vietnamese places. I walked out full and satisfied. Will return again.

Disappointed! Pho Saigon 8 has two other locations that have been open for many years. This location is their newest one and does not meet the quality of the others. The Eastern and 215 location is the best.

FOOD: We tried serval different dishes and sadly is was not good at all. Everything was bland and overcooked, from the meat to the noodles to the soup. The most decent dish was the spring rolls.

DRINK: They sell Vietnamese dessert drinks, sodas, beers, and wine. I didn't want to get any drinks considering how bad the food was.

SERVICE: They are extremely unstaffed. They have one cashier, one waiter, one server, and one bus boy. It took forever for someone to seat us and even longer for someone to come take our order. They came and took our order three times and yet our food still did not come out. As I looked around the restaurant, I could tell that the other customers were annoyed as well. The server and the cooks kept arguing with each other and it quickly became awkward (especially since I speak Vietnamese and can understand what they are saying). They did not bring us drinks, utensils, or anything unless we asked. When it was time to pay, the cashier was no where to be found as many tables were waiting to pay, it turned out he was doing something outside the restaurant and the server had to go get him.

NOTE: I rarely give this low of a rating and review, but I am so disappointed with their food and service.

I've been to many pho places looking for the best pho and this one is probably one of the ones I would recommend to anyone. Aside from the pho, the food is great. The Barbecue plates and dishes are my favorite and it keeps me coming back for more. Love this place. It's clean and the service is great.
Great service and friendly employees. Food was delicious and served quickly, even with a full house!

Out of all the Pho spots in the Southwest area, Rainbow/215, I'd choose Pho Saigon 8 rather than Jenni Pho or Pho Annie. 

Main reasons is their fast and friendly customer service. The prices are reasonable. We've been here multiple times and they are prompt with serving water(s) while you take a look at what you want to order. Never have we felt rushed or impatiently waiting for service. The restaurant is large enough to cater to large groups. They have a couple big screen TV's around with the sports channel on. Go Knights Go! 

My usual order is No. 11 (noodle with rare eye round) in a small. Broth is good. Can't forget to add Hoisin sauce and  Siracha chili to give it some kick. The egg rolls are always a must. 

No cash? Don't fret! They accept cards here. Not like another pho place I know, that was cash only (no bueno).

It was mediocre . Pho was like warm not the broth Iv had if u absolutely need pho and every pho place is mysteriously closed I mean I guess u could come here 

I also ordered vegan print rolls . GROSS the tofu was fried but has a weird pungent taste 

14.26$ was my total for pho and veggie spring rolls def. not coming back 

Maybe they still need to tweak some of thier recipes .

My husband ordered over the phone for pick up, a pho combination. Usually they would come with meatballs right??? Not at all! And that's his favorite part of it. And then only 1 piece of tendon.. really??? Never again!

As a first timer here, the pho tai was absolutely delicious. Everything was pretty spot on from the customer service, to the presentation, to the meal. Hopefully this isn't just because of their grand opening. Definitely think this pho restaurant will be a hot spot as long as they continue doing exactly what they're doing.

I tried two other Pho places in the area, and this one serves the best broth. The other ones are just not as flavorful. Lots of seating and service was fine. I did notice that the older female waitress appeared colder than her younger counterparts but she treated us well and thanked us for coming when we left. So maybe she's not the warmest person in the world, but we rolled with it and didn't seem to have a problem. It's worth it for the pho. Until I find a better place in this area of Las Vegas, Pho Saigon 8 has my business.

So i finally tried this place after getting some clarification on the ingredients of the broth.  The owner was very prompt and answering my questions. My main concern is that there were no animal products in the veggie broth. I am happy to report having tried it I did not detect any animal products in it. Additionally has now become my favorite place for pho as the place I had previously been going to the Brass was overly salty. They have a very mild broth with good flavor, and are extremely generous with the fresh veggies and condiments. Very important to note for those of you who are vegan you must request the veggie broth.#vegan
Yay! Authentic Vietnamese Pho. Good size portions, not too greasy or salty. Clean restaurant.  Very little wait. Good servers.

I love the food here everything is really tasty and the price is pretty good. They make your food really fast I don't have to wait long. Sometimes I order Togo and they take like only 10 minutes to prepare my food.
They have amazing flan with great texture. I tried the Thai tea. Real good and rich. Also, they have good bread. I think it's like a French bread roll for dipping into the soup.

Was in there yesterday with the family. Pho was delicious, pricing was good, service was quick but very pushy I felt rushed out place was empty but they were in a hurry to get us out.  We all felt pushed out, weird.

Came here for dinner a few days ago as it was really cold and we all wanted something warm/hot after a day of helping a friend move. This was something nearby and we all agreed. 

We were immediately sat at a table when we arrived and had gotten waters. 

2 of us gotten #21 large (Noodle w/ rare eye of round, flank, brisket, tendon, and skirt flank). 1 had gotten the #11 small (Noodle with rare eye of round). Another had gotten #15 small (Noodle with rare eye of round and beef ball). One of my friends had gotten the sausage/pork roll (i believe was #5) as he had other dinner plans (which got we later found out next day that they were canceled.... Lol) 

As with all pho noodle soups, it comes with a plate with fresh herbs, bean sprouts, jalapeno slices, and wedges of lime. 

Reason why i got #21 is that it is most similar to what is called "Combination Pho or Pho Dac Biet" in a lot of other restaurants, which is essentially the one with everything. The only thing that this didn't have that some others may have is either tripe or beef balls. Average sized large bowl. Good amount of meat and noodles. Add herbs and bean sprouts to the bottom under the noodles, squeeze some limes and you gots a good bowl of pho. Oh a side dish of hoisin and sriracha too for dipping meat. I don't know if it was because i was super hungry and barely had food, or was cold cuz of weather, but this hit the spot, even if it didnt last that long (got hungry later at night.. haha)

The restaurant is mildly small and could get busy due to limited seats but its a fairly decent size. Prices seem mildly higher than those in Chinatown but for convenience if you are in the area, the price difference is very negligible. 

They are willing to split the bill without restrictions which was good. Not really much complaints besides some unreasonable ones (like not enough meat, not enough noodles.. should have ordered some egg rolls (cha gio) too ! but wait werent they considerably more pricey than other places...?) lol... .right? unreasonable.. hahaha !
We have been here a few times and kept thinking the pho broth would be better...it would come out warm but not hot like it should be. Hopefully it'll improve in the future!
Very good. I have been here at least 1 time my last 3 times in Vegas and the food is consistently good in all 3 locations. Portions are large and service is quick.

7.1.17 @ 8pm was my 2nd visit.  Place is new and I have been to their other 2 locations.  Typical cheap Asian set up.  The food is good but the service is horrible. The young male waiter is has no social skills.  I get it, there is no service at most if not all Vietnamese restaurants.  When the check came my wife went to pay at the front. The check was like 41 & change, she gave him 45$ worth and got her change back and the SOB says to her and I quote "No Tip" with attitude, so she responded it "its on the table".  Lucky for him she didnt tell me this until we got home.  In my 48 yrs of life, not once have I encountered such attitude from the wait staff.  These Viet places dont provide service, just food and they expect 5 star tipping.  You work on tip so work for it.  My wife tipped 8usd but we shall never go to any Saigon 8 again.  Yes they talk about you behind your back when you leave crappy tip, I know cuz I can understand them.  Its the typical Viet attitude wanting things for free or more of it.  Go back to your to your caveman ways yo... from another Viet to Saigon 8....."yeah I am a banana but I love it"
This restaurant has amazing food and the cleanest windows I've ever seen. The inside is clean and the staff is friendly.

Great tasting pho, however, the my hai my tho was a bit salty. The service was good, our server was attentive and checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying our meal. That's good service, except for the only one napkin per person deal. Lol. They provided us with more when asked though. Anyways, it's good pho!

A friend took me to lunch for pho and I was not disappointed. This place was clean, well kept, and the servers were friendly. The pho broth had some really good flavors. There was plenty of meats and a variety of choice of noodles (a new experience for me). I will have to return to try the other noodle choices. Love the fact that it's nearby.

My boyfriend introduced me to Pho Saigon 8 when we first started dating.  I was skeptical because I was a die hard Pho So 1 fan.  Obviously when you're loyal to a certain restaurant it's hard when you stray...what if you cheat on your go-to and it isn't as good?  Well, Saigon 8 certainly surprised me.

I only order three things at Vietnamese restaurants: Pho Tai, Com Bo Luc Lac, and egg rolls.  Saigon 8 absolutely knocks it out of the park with all three of these dishes.  

I do slightly prefer Pho So 1's tomato rice with their bo luc lac, but the onions are more prominent in Saigon 8's version.  The fresh coconut juice here is always fresh and delicious too!

I never order anything else on the menu so I can't speak for any other dishes, but the food is always consistently great here and the waiters are friendly as well. 

When this location opened closer to my house I wanted to cry tears of joy. My lazy self never wants to drive more than 5-10 minutes for food...now, I don't have to ever again (for pho at least). YAY!
Best pho place in Vegas in my opinion. Service and food was amazing! I will be coming back here for sure and referring my family and friends.
So happy that this place opened near work. Had Pho Tai today and the soup was hot and tasty. I also had a refreshing coconut on the side. Got a free egg roll today, which is a bonus. Will be back!

This was my first time here at Pho Saigon 8, and apparently they also have a couple of other locations. The place was clean, and the service was very good. I started off with the eggrolls, which were very good, but not greasy. For dinner I had the beef pho. The broth was really good and fresh. I ordered a large pho, and interestingly it came with a good portion of beef, but not so much in noodles. I was still very much full and it definitely hit the spot. I must say this place is one of the better pho places in Vegas, and I'm happy that they have a location in the Southwest side if town. I highly recommend this place

Thanks for bringing Pho 8 as an addition to other Vietnamese restaurants to this area. I don't have to go all the way to Chinatown just to eat anymore. I enjoyed every dish I ordered so far. Loved it!

I've dined in this place at least five times this past month, which should pretty much illustrate how devoted I am to this restaurant. Food is delicious, reasonably priced, and much closer than Chinatown. Above all else, it feels very clean there. My new go-to spot for Viet food - don't go to Annie Pho, Pho 88, or Jenni pho.
Probably the best pho I've ever had and the most hospitable service also! I will recommend this to everyone around.
Great food and service! Came in because it was close to the house and was pleasantly surprised considering there are several pho places in the southwest area.

walked in at 11:42, and was told they were closed. Signage said open till 12:00. I realize people don't want to stay later than they are open, but I asked to order to go, and was still turned away, Oh well, a 10 minute drive to China town it is...
The best pho and bun cha dish I've ever had. This place best Pho 88, Jenni pho and Pho Kim Long in my book. Fresh food and clean and cozy restaurant. Thumbs up recommended.

One Friday night I made a call to pick up some food. when I arrive there was nobody around when I finally found somebody I guess he was a bust her I let him know I was there for a pick up he didn't even say hello to me didn't smile and when I told him I was there for a pick up he didn't even respond to me he just looked at me with the blank face and then walked away. I wasn't feeling good and I was already upset that I had to wait finally I found another man asked me how can I help you and I told him I have been waiting for my food I let your other employee know but I guess he didn't tell you anything. He apologized and guess what my food was on the table right there for like 10 minutes or longer so I told him I don't know why he wouldn't say anything or if he didn't understand my English maybe he should've asked somebody for help. He then said oh sorry and he said I wasn't wearing a jacket it's cold out and I told him yeah I was just planning to run in and out but I'm here waiting. So I paid for my food and went home when I got home my chicken and noodle plate was cold and I had to re-cook them at least my pho still somewhat hot. I was very annoyed with the service here I don't think I will be back and it's unfortunate because it is very close to my house.

Wifey ordered a soup and waiter brings out wrong soup. Wife says wrong soup" 
Waiter: no it's what you ordered. 
Wife : can I have the other soup 
Waiter: no 
Me:hahahahahahahajaha
Wife :pissed.

Dropped in for late night dinner after a workout at Planet Fitness conveniently across the street. I can't find anything bad with the place so it must be good? It's open till midnight, it is easy to get to and park, the setting is chill, the service is friendly, food came out timely and was good, $11 for a rice dish with pork which is ok. I got fried rice with pork & egg which was pretty tasty. They also brought out an extra egg roll which was a nice touch. I definitely will drop in here again!
My favorite pho place in Vegas ! I got the #16  (rare eye round, flank, and brisket) and the BBQ pork rolls. They were both really good and the service was awesome!

Went to this place twice. Had pho twice. It was ok twice. 
The servers are, how should I say, special? The broth isn't the best I ever had. Meh.
Food was okay... rice was undercooked... service was okay, not the best.  Wouldn't be my first choice.
My fav vietnamese restaurant in the southwest. The food is fresh and delicious. Worth every penny.
Pho Saigon is great, me and all my gfs go there all the time. David is the best and he always tries to make us have a great experience he is really funny and they give the best service!
Excellent! So happy this location finally opened. The food was great and we loved the soft jazz music in the background. Peter was very attentive and friendly. We'll be back soon!

This is becoming one of my favorite vietnamese restaurants. I don't have to drive all the way to Spring Mountain and it's near my house. It is located in the plaza accross the street from Walmart on 215/Rainbow. 2 of my friends kept telling me to try this restaurant and I am sooo glad I finally did. It looks like the have 3 other locations in town.
My favorite items to get from here are the vegetable spring rolls-fresh and sooo delicious and veggie pho with beef broth (and no I am not a vegetarian). Each time I have gone here, it's packed with people, but you don't have to wait too long to be seated. I can't wait to try other dishes on their menu.

I ordered #16 Pho and an order of tofu spring rolls to go. Everything was packaged very nicely and tasted absolutely delicious. I ordered the large thinking I was somehow going to finish it on my own, but I was wrong the servings are huge and now I have delicious leftovers. I loved the crispy tofu inside the spring rolls with the peanut sauce. The broth from the pho was outstanding. I will definitely be coming back here.

Very kid friendly and excellent service!! They have scissors, spoons, forks, extra napkins all ready for you so you don't have to ask 5x. The best kid friendly place I've been! Food is delicious as well. We recommend the Thai tea!
I usually come to this location since they recently opened next to my favorite foot spa, Pure Foot & Spa on 215 rainbow. This location is small and offers a variety of items on the menu.

Pretty much one of the best pho I've ever had. The place is clean, good service and the food came out fast. Pho was very tasty, the beef quality is better than most places and the soup was very on point. They got one star taken out because I ordered the large and was more like between the size of regular and large. 
Price is also slightly higher than most places.
Pretty average. I picked up on a Sunday evening. Had one of the beef Pho. It wasn't bad but I've certainly had better. Not a lot of flavor

First time to this location.  I was very impressed.  Its very new and super clean.  Hope it stays that way.  Food was very good and seemed a bit bigger than other locations which I am definitely not complaining about.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Definitely helps that its closer to my place.  Now we don't have to drive to Chinatown to find a decent pho place.

Stopped by this pho restaurant before driving home. We were seated right away and the food was amazing. Reminded me of the pho and Asian food back home! I recommend anyone that's craving asian food to try this place out!

I'd have to say Pho Saigon's broth is the best flavored pho in the southwest. We'll definitely be returning here during the days we don't feel like cooking or when we just need that bowl of quick pho fix. 

My husband ordered a large pho tai nam, and I ordered the small #20. The bowls had tons of meat. I feel like I usually don't have enough meat to noodle ratio at other places. We also ordered the Chinese sausage fried rice for the kids. That was really delicious, all of my kids approve!! 

One star off because a few of the utensils they gave us were dirty. They had residual smear marks on the soup spoons and regular silver spoon. Also, when we asked for a box to take our left over fried rice, the guy was looking another direction while handing the box to my husband. It was kind of funny, but since he wasn't paying attention, he almost hit my husband in the face with the box hahaha. My husband was so annoyed but I thought it was funny. Please just pay attention to who or where you're handing something to.
Very good service... excellent food... very clean environment...not expensive... large menu to choose from... beer and wine available... and dessert

So happy about this new SW side location, the best Pho in town is now just minutes away instead of driving to China Town. Order the egg rolls, pho with brisketanf shrimp fried rice!!! All of it is amazing and authentic. The Avocado smoothie with boba is a delicious sweet dessert!! 
So happy to have this in the neighborhood!!!
The staff is super attentive and there to please.

Late night eats available here until midnight except Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday only open till 11PM.

After looking the menu over we ordered the Beef broth pho with steak, delicious noodle and tasty broth 5/5. And the chicken breast rice plate with soup 4/5. Tasty chicken flavored well and some fish sauce to dip it in. 

For dessert we chose the Suong Sa Hat Luu, which is tapioca jelly with green bean paste and coconut milk, 5/5!

Very clean new restaurant and good service 5/5. Will be back again when we need our Pho fill...
The pho here is great! The food is served fast and is always tasty. They have a wide selection of pho and other authentic dishes.

Pho Saigon 8 has always been one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants to eat at. So happy they opened one up by our house. We always get the same every time, husband gets pho dac biet, spring rolls, egg rolls, and my favorite bun bo hue. It's always on point, the service is on point, and it's clean. Enjoy.

It was an easy fix for PHO off of the S. Rainbow Area. One of my favorite appetizers/starters at a Vietnamese Restaurant is Spring Rolls and I wasn't all that impressed with them it had more lettuce then noodles or anything else. The service was not the greatest either considering there was only 2 other tables occupied in the restaurant, they were extremely slow taking our order, getting our drinks and our bill. However we enjoyed the egg rolls and the Pork & Shrimp Vermicelli very much

Great Pho place by 215 and Rainbow, same plaza as Einstein Bagel and the 7 eleven.
I was reading reviews about Pho over the weekend and this one guys, because of your reviews... made me think pho pho pho lol
Took my friend there for a quick lunch today. Place is clean. It was busy. As soon i walked in the waiver found is a table and iced water was served right away without us asking.
Service was fast and good.
i ordered pho meat ball (of course) and we ordered beef luc lac. My pho broth was delicious and very tasty. I ate it all and even drink all the broth LOL
the Beef luc loc is accompanied by a bowl of broth (nice)
the beef luc lac comes with steamed rice or tomato rice. Never had that before, the rice was so so Good! I was looking around what people ordered ... PHO PHO PHO so i will have to come back and order other dish and try it all!
$24 lunch for 2
I will happily go eat there again :) 
they open from 10:30am to midnight!!! is that awesome??
I have ate at pho Saigon 8 twice in the last 2 months. Great service and tasty food.  I had the #16 which was really good.
Pho was delicious.  Taste like the pho Saigon in Sacramento.  The beef was very flavorful and you must try the colorful dessert.  It's so good.

I love that this place is open late.  On my recent visit I was stopping by for take out.  The employee at the register was friendly, patient, and eager to make suggestions.  After I ordered they even offered me iced water in a to-go cup while I wait. I ordered pho among other things and it was well packaged and I had no spills in the car.  

I enjoyed their meatball pho, seafood flat noodles, and chicken porridge.

This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant on rainbow! Nice atmosphere, friendly servers and good food. We tried the Vietnamese udon and grilled pork with egg rolls over broken rice and some spring rolls. Spring roll were fresh and the sauce was so good! I can't wait to try the rice flour wrap with pork pasted they just put out!

It's Friday....and decided its "Pho-day" . Located near our hearty home we wanted to check this place out after shopping. Food was quick to serve,  taste was on point to our liking,  staff was friendly, and meals were reasonably price.

We ordered 2 Large #14 pho noodle soup with round steak and tendons and spring rolls as an appetizer. Mmmm, that was delicious. We will definitely be back. Happy eats!
So happy that pho Saigon 8 is in my hood,I'm up in here 3 times week.best Vietnam food in Las Vegas....no bullshit!!!!!!

Tonight after 9pm  i ordered 2 appetizer togo,because half price,and when i pick-up my order and they said the happy hour only for dining,togo is full price,alright,why doesn't say anything when people order happy hour food,and there's no sign or anything says when you order to go you can't get happy hour price?and the waiter has a bad attitude .

Typically my family goes to the Pho Saigon on Eastern but since this was central we decided to come here and big mistake it's worth the drive to eat at the other location. There is this one lady I believe her name is Thuy (older with a mean face) she wouldn't let the other wait staff take our order or even help service our party of 8. She was rude and obviously doesn't care about customer service! They messed up our order 2 times and she tried to blame that we said it wrong, when clearly she could easily just fix it. I will never come here again!

Yummy. Solid bowl of pho. Spring rolls and summer were both great. My friend got the mango green tea and it was really yummy. Sweet. The red chili sauce was good with the summer/spring rolls. Good food, decently priced.

I ordered the Bun Bo Hue with rice noodles over the phone for pick up and I think this dish is better to eat in the restaurant, the broth was still super hot when my dad dropped it off. The broth wasn't spicy to my liking even with the chili on the side but overall it was still good I just added more chilli oil that I have at home.  I would order the soup bete again the broth is really good not bland like Pho 88.  Try this dish with rice noodles it's so much better than regular noodles you don't feel guilty.

I usually get a large #21 and an order of fried egg rolls.  Bill usually comes out to around $18.  A little steep, but totally worth it.  

The egg rolls are always hot and crispy served with lettuce, cilantro, carrots, and radishes.  I love making lettuce wraps with my egg roll or with some noodles and meat in my bowl of pho.  I guess it is the korean in me that makes me do this.

The #21 has pretty much all of the meats including tendon.  Only thing missing are the beefballs and tripe.  The broth tastes the same as their location on Spring Mountain.  I feel like the bowl is a little smaller than most other places that serve a larage, but i always leave super full.  So it could just be an optical illusion.  

Service is ok.  I wouldn't say it is great, but it isn't bad either.  This location is new so I figure they are still getting the kinks worked out.  I highly recommend this place for anyone craving pho.  You will leave full and happy.

Nous avons bien aimé notre diner. Petit restaurant familial ou nous avons pu apprécier un 78 et 56. Bons plats copieux pour 30$ pour 2 personnes. Arriver vers 18h30, la salle était tranquille.  Vers 19h30 il y a plus de monde. Nous reviendrons !

I was told that this place had good food, so my friend and I came here in observance of my birthday. When we were seated, we told the waiter that we needed time to look at the menu. We hadn't seen each other in a while, so we were chatting while looking at the menu. Within less than 3 minutes, we were abruptly asked by the same waiter and a waitress whether we were ready. Talk about pushy. I picked something quickly on the menu so they would stop pestering us, and my friend found something shortly afterward. I honestly wanted to leave, but my friend didn't want to fight traffic to find another place, so we stayed and tried to make the best of it.

When we received our food, it was fine, though we have had much better Vietnamese food elsewhere in town. I put some chili sauce on my noodle bowl and left it next to my food in case I wanted more. An older male waiter came by and snatched up the chili sauce without even asking whether I was done with it. I'm not joking. When I went to the restroom, I saw that they had several large containers of chili sauce on a shelf in the hallway, so it's not as though they were short on sauce for other customers. 

Overall, it was a bad experience, and the staff showed themselves to be rude and impersonal towards their customers, which is nonsensical since customers are the ones who provide their livelihood. Maybe they should remember that. We will not be back.

They have plenty of food choices and everything was very good. The food also came out fast and I like that.
However, I wasn't a big fan of the customer service.. they don't greet you when you walk in or really talk to you at all. They just ask if we're ready to order and write down everything we order quietly and leave. 
They also don't check on us and ask if everything was okay. I noticed 4 of the waiters/waitresses would sit in the back booth and talk until one of us had to wave and ask them to come over. 
I don't think their customer service was all that great and I suggest to work on that.

I rarely submit negative reviews but had a bad experience at this restaurant. I work walking distance away and have always eaten here for lunch however today the waiter brought out an incorrect item which I was fine with. I asked for clean brisket with no fat and the person brought out brisket with a ton of fat. The lady replaced it and apologized which I was fine with. When I went to pay, the cashier took my $100 bill and used the counterfeit money marker which is totally fine but even after the marker showed it was a real $100 bill, he asked for a second opinion. The next person came and used the pen again and then asked for a third opinion. The lady held my bill under the light and clearly saw it was real but continued to inspect the bill. She also put the bill next to a counterfeit one to feel the paper and see if its real. At this point I was very annoyed and took out a $1000 of $100s to show that they are all real. I had to pull out my badge to show them I am a neighbor of the business and have always eaten there. The food is great but the experience was terrible. I refer everyone at my work to eat there but that will not be happening going forward.

Worst service ever.. order soup based upon picture.. waiter brought out a different soup. When I request to switch he said no that's what you ordered. I never like to send food back but I was craving a particular soup so it was very annoying. I come to this restaurant at least once a week and the lady server is always nice. She was not here today so my order got messed up. :-(

Thank you for relying but I didn't change my mind. It was not what I ordered. After he refused to take it back I didn't want to make a scene & uncomfortable for my husband. I've been in community for many years & many of our friends and family go there but we will take our business somewhere else since both you & your staff are missing the svc point. Thank you.

After I ordered about $50 worth of food to go... I asked for a little bit of soup broth for my rice meal(which usually comes in free when you dine in)... she said it's $2 extra for it. Fine then, no more Saigon for us... there's plenty of Pho places now out here on the SW side. Thank you for being stingy...should be minus star!

UPDATED:

So I totally understand about controlling your costs. I am all for it. So tell me why INSTEAD OF TELLING ME I HAD TO PAY, she just tells me no, I just can't have it. I explained to her I didn't expect to get the PHO veggies for free. 

Then, when I asked for extra veggies of WHAT COMES  WITH IT, I am charged another $2?!? 

Come on. The location on JONES and Spring Mountain HAS NEVER EVER EVER charged for extra veggies. 

ON TOP of the AWFUL customer service I experienced from the elderly woman at the register. She's rude and interrupts you when you are asking questions. 

If I could give negative starts for the experience I had tonight, I would. -- $4 for veggies. Absolutely unbelievable. More than HALF the cost of my actual food I ordered. There is something WRONG with that picture, especially when I get home and see THE VEGGIES ARE SKIMPED ON ANYWAY!!! (Hahah!) Geeeez man. 
_____________________
_____________________

I ordered egg rolls and asked for extra veggies - 1 bag of what usually comes with it and another of what comes with the soup. Instead of offering to have me pay a little extra, the woman just straight up tells me "no" / "no what?" / "you cant have that. We can't do that." 

Now, I didn't say this to her, but I'm just thinking TJ myself, what on earth do you mean you "CANT" do that? I am a paying (AND RETURNING) customer for crying out loud. 

It's the LITTLEST things that can either bring your consumers BACK or ensure they bad mouth you to whoever they know that will listen; ultimately resulting in loss of business for your establishment. 

I mean, really? A bag of veggies? How petty can you people seriously be?

AWSOME! First time I came here and it was very good! Good service! Clean and nice looking place, and the best part the soup taste exactly like it suppose to- incredible!
Will be back soon :) (ordered vegetarian broth with tofu)
Consistent quality with the best bun dishes in area. They have a friendly staff and very large portions.

So glad to find their new location is open late! Just as tasty an hour before closing as it is during busy lunch hour. Favorites are rare brisket pho and seafood pho with extra limes. Never disappointed!

Amazing Pho! Right by my house!! 
Yay!!!
I asked for extra jalapeños and boy did they give me extra. 
#16 is what I always order and it hasn't failed to be delicious once!

Great Vietnamese place in Las Vegas. And it's not even in the chinatown area. Pretty authentic Vietnamese food, especially for Vegas. The bun was good, and the pho had a really good broth, not too sweet like many others.

Came here for lunch with the family. Overall, the food is ok. It's not the best pho, but it wasn't bad either. The bun bo hue was a bit lacking in flavor, although it came with all the right ingredients (the coagulated blood was nicely cooked). The spring rolls were ok, with too much lettuce inside, but the dipping sauce was flavorful. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if you live around here, it's not a bad option.
This place is the OG original,  one of a best restaurants, food is made fresh and hot also customer service is outstanding

This place was terrible! They messed up our order and when I called to ask if they could correct it the man on the phone said "I don't give a fuck." And hung up on me. Terrible customer service. I'm a vegetarian and I believe there might have been meat in my food because I was violently sick. Probably food poisoning or meat was put into a vegetarian dish. Beware this place! Worst food I've had in vegas.

Good food & service. 

I was promptly seated, and given a glass of water. The food was hot & fresh, and did not skimp on the portion. My order came with soup and sauce for the eggrolls. Everything tasted great. 

Nice ambiance (with music), and spacious seating. Clean bathroom.
the 1 free drink coupon is only good for happy hr. did not explain well on the site, service is ok, food is ok too

Update: I usually order the white meat chicken pho, but the texture of the chicken isn't my favorite so I decided to try the dark meat chicken during my last visit. No surprise, I disliked it even more than the white chicken. Thinking they had good customer service, I asked the server if I could just have the white chicken instead brought to me on a side plate since I really didn't eat any of the dark chicken. The server's response was, "are you kidding me?" which threw me off a little. I've been going to Pho Saigon 8 on Spring Mountain for years and have never had this problem. If a customer doesn't like their food, you would think they would at least apologize or accommodate to their needs to make the rest of your visit better. I guess not here. Maybe I'll just get a different item from the menu. Sigh.

This new location is so clean and the service is quick. They're always filling your water and always grabbing dirty plates out of the way. Not only is the service quick, but the staff is also very friendly! They make sure everyone at the table is satisfied with their service. For their grand opening, they're giving their guests complimentary spring rolls which is very generous of them. I recommend bringing your family here as it is also very family friend! Lastly, the location is very convenient and near everything. Give them a visit and order their amazing appetizers.

love this place!  Their pho finally convinced my husband of how delicious pho can be. This is the only pho place my husband trusts and its his favorite place to go for dinner on a cold day. The service is great, everyone is friendly and fast.  We have ordered for pick up and have done sit down service. Their raw beef, beef ball and chicken phos are our faves. Also enjoyed their spring rolls and egg rolls with lots of fresh veggies.  Great fish sauce btw.  Also their pho saved my life when i caught the flu. We did a lot of pick up of chicken pho that week!  Anytime i start feeling a cold coming on, this is my go to place and it helps me get rid of it.  Looking forward to my next visit!!

First time here at the Rainbow location! Ordered Pho tai ( rare steak) and spring rolls. They also brought me a complimentary egg roll for coming in ! Everything was delicious!!! So excited to have good Pho on the southwest side of town. They serve beer and wine too! 
Great place. I'll definitely be back :)

Mostly Pho restaurants are all the same but what makes this restaurant deserving of a
5-star? Excellent service! It was Saturday afternoon and they were pretty busy but as soon as we were seated, we ordered food and in 5 mins food was ready. There were 5 of us and we ordered 3 Large Pho, 5 diff appetizers and 3 rice and bulgogi dish all ready in 5 mins.

Stopped here for takeout the other night and was very impressed! The lady who answered the phone was friendly and helpful (especially because I totally forgot one of the names of the dishes I wanted to order). The food was ready quickly and although we didn't dine in, the decor looked nice! 

We loved the spring rolls and definitely would go back for those alone! The beef pho broth was good, but I was really impressed by the vegetarian broth! It was so flavorful that I didn't even miss the meat!

Pho Saigon 8 has always been one of my favorite Vietnamese Restaurants. I am quite happy when they recently opened a branch closer to home at Rainbow and 215. I used to go to the Henderson branch at least once a week for lunch and when I do, I usually bring friends and/or co-workers since it's only a few minutes away from the office. We recently moved our office near the Spring Mountain Branch so I now take my friends and co-workers there. As a Fathers Day gift, my family wanted to take me out to dinner so I suggested that we go to a Vietnamese restaurant. Since Fathers Day was quite busy at home due to relatives visiting, we decided to go a day after. We decided to go to the one close to home, Rainbow and 215. I decided to order something different from the usual Pho Dac Biet this time. That's when the problem started. I decided I wanted to try some beef balls so I ordered #20 from the menu. The server brought me the wrong order, #22 which had no beef balls. When I told the manager (I think he was the manager because he was tending the register and was kind of rude), he stated that what I ordered didn't have beef balls. However, he'll just bring me some beef balls separately in a bowl instead of correcting the error. Since he was going to bring me a bowl of beef balls which is what I wanted, I said that would work, no problem. When we got the bill, this guy charged us for the extra beef balls. When I asked why, he stated that the beef balls were separate and I would have gotten a lesser amount if it came with my original order. It was very disappointing. I was trying to be nice and this guy had taken advantage. Our bill was $51.20 including the extra beef balls. My daughter works as a barista in one of the nice coffee shops in town and is a very generous tipper. She could have given them at least twice the amount of the beef balls in tips if not more had they taken them out of the bill. My son recommended to just pay the bill and not argue about the $4 or so beef balls. We paid and left without leaving gratuities. Not only that they lost a few dollars in tips, they also lost regular customers. Goodbye Pho Saigon 8. This was our last. There are plenty of Vietnamese Restaurants in town who are just as good if not better. Your beef balls were good though. LOL!
This place always has great service along with making the food very quick. I usually get their #16 pho.

Really great Pho carry out! I was feeling sick and knew that some Pho no meat would do the trick. I called ahead and had my friend run in and grab it. It was all packaged separately and it was delicious. Looking forward to going back.
My girlfriend is extremely picky about where she gets her pho, this was our first time ordering from Pho Saigon 8 and we where very please with the pho & egg rolls.

I was so happy they opened up this place by my house on Rainbow. I used to have to drive to there other location in China town . Which I didn't mind because their food is very delicious. The service at the Rainbow location was fantastic everytime I go there. They are always on point! I love that they have wine there and saki. I normally order the beef spare ribs with rice and there egg rolls with lettuce. The egg rolls is so flavorful and always hot with a nice crunch. My family goes here minimum once a week! My son in law loves there Pho ! He says it's the best in town!! I will be a customer for life! Highly recommended!!

Pho Saigon 8 is our favorite pho place.  We have been at all the popular pho locations but Pho Saigon 8 is our favorite.  We always get the pho tai and the broth is the best.  It is so savory compared to the rest.  The other places have a sweetness to it we don't like.  We also get the fried rolls which is awesome.  We use to go to the spring mountain location, but this Rainbow location is much closer and newer.  Best pho in town!

7 months ago, I left a 5 star review for this place. Me and my husband and family regularly eat here twice a week since the last 7 months. 

However in the last 4 times we came to eat here, I get a stomach ache at the bottom of my stomach immediately after and it last for up to 24 hours. This has been happening the last 4 times I've been there like I said. I am so sad and disappointed coz this was my favorite pho place. But now I have to say goodbye Pho Saigon 8. I can't keep coming back to a restaurant just to get stomach aches. 

My old review 7 months ago: highly recommend this place. Everything came out excellent. We ordered fresh spring rolls, pho with round eye and tendon and lastly pho with flank steak. I love how neat and clear their menu is and how they put a lot of pictures on their menu as well. Their bathroom was impressive too. Looked very clean compared to other asian/pho restaurants I've been too. Will definitely come back to this place next time I crave for pho.

I usually don't give out bad reviews but the service here was really BAD! My gf and I sat there for 15mins and nobody approached us NOT even for water. They took the orders of the group that came after us first and got them drinks before us. So we left. This was the second time that we experienced a horrible service here. WE WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE OR RECOMMENDED THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!

I dig. Pho Saigon 8 was one of my favorites driving to Chinatown. I was happy to learn that it opened on restaurant road (rainbow blvd) and close to the 215 exit. It looks like they even take online orders which it seems like lots of places are doing it. Welcome to the technology world! 

The pho tai itself was decent. I like my pho broth to be savory and not sweet so this broth met its criteria. The egg rolls on the other hand were too peppery. Overall I think the pho is decent and service was ok (it wasn't during any meal rushes). I like pho because generally it's fast enough so that with two kids in tow it's not a long wait. It's a win win and glad that we have other options for some pho especially with the temperature dropping. Parking might be tough but it is restaurant road.

I would've given 5 stars because their food is amazing but I hate calling in an order and everyone I speak to always act like they don't understand English. Especially if the request is simple... for example, no carrots.

This place has been opened for a year now and the food is fresh and delicious. The service is very friendly and efficient. They deliver customer service the right way especially in Las Vegas.
We ordered late at 11 pm both the Pho beef/flank/brisket and #42 dry Combo noodles with the broth on the side. Excellent broth and delicious noodle bowls. Thank you for a pleasant experience.
Really great lemonade, make sure to stir it. Amazing egg rolls. Wonderful pho tai. Friendly service at the counter and table. Eye contact and smiles. Good prices. It was just really solid.
Very relaxing area. Nice place to eat and service is fast. Music is also very relaxing which is they always have the station at 91.5 smooth jazz.
Very Tasty. I am so glad, I stopped. The vegetarian pho was perfect. The service was prompt. Even the veggie spring rolls were excellent.

Been here several times now and out of all the times I've never had a bad experience. 

I usually order two things. Com Thit Nuong and Bum Bo Hue. The Com Thit Nuong's beef has a bit of charr to it which makes for the perfect crunch.This dish also comes with the pho soup. So if you're deciding if you want soup or rice you should just get this cause it comes with soup. So you get the best of both worlds. To make the perfect pho soup it cannot be salty. It's literally a large bowl of bone broth. It should be very clear and tasteful. If it makes you thirsty, then there's probably extra salt.

I am a big fan of spicy soup. Especially with pork blood. I know it sounds gross, but don't knock it till you try it. This restaurant by far has the best Bum Bo Hue. What makes them different is they don't have all the oil in it. Most pho places that make this soup adds too much chili oil. So when I drink it alone, I can taste a spoon full of oil. The broth here is spicy and tasteful. They don't add too much meat where it over powers your bowl. The noodles is the perfect amount. Note: they do not make this in a small. If you get the large, you won't regret it. 

Pricing: it is cheap!! 

Parking - the restaurant is located in the same center as the 7-11 and Mcdonalds. There's plenty of parking. At no charge :)

The food here is really good and the restaurant is quite clean too. I used to go to the spring mountain location but I moved. So you can imagine I was pretty excited when they opened up this location that was much closer. I would recommend you giving them a try. Their rice vermicelli and rice dishes can't go wrong.

Great service and super fast. I ordered beef pho less than 3 minutes later I had my order it was hot and very delicious. I was amazed since it was a full house. I will totally recommend this restaurant to anyone who has a Pho craving. I been to many Pho restaurants but this restaurant was just to fast love it.

If you want a really good bowl of pho, I recommend this place. I ordered rare and well cooked beef pho. The spring rolls are really good too. 

I ordered wine haha that was a plus !

Ginormous hearty bowls of pho! 

I used to frequent the location on Eastern and came here for the first time the other day. I'm a huge fan for the taste and quality of the pho.

- Open restaurant - plenty of comfy booths and tables for seating 
- Averaging $9 for a regular bowl of pho, $10 for a large bowl of pho 
- Beansprouts are clean, fresh, and trimmed (some pho places they're just brown, stringy, and gross) 
- Broth is flavorful and delish just like the Eastern location 
- You can order LEAN brisket! It's not fatty and the meat is just as soft! 
- Pho is filled with generous portions of meat and vermicelli noodles 
- Service was average - nothing extravagant

This would probably be my #1 recommendation for pho if you're in the Southwest area. I didn't try any of their other dishes or teas - however - for a delicious bowl of pho it's definitely worth the visit!
This place is awesome, food and service are excellent.  Recommend this to anyone. The noodle soup I ordered was hot and delicious

I've always come here with my family of 8 people and had great and fast service. Today I was so disappointed with the service. The server sit us and left. He then sit another table with 3 ppl after us. He took their orders and brought out drinks for them. I looked at him and he said since we had a big group so he going to come to us after. Wth does that have to do with first come first served! Then he just walked back and forth like he had nothing to do. I got so irritated and got up and left! 


Tonight I brought my family back because we do love this place. Peter, the manager was very nice and professional. He recognized me and came to apologized for the incident. I wasn't expecting for anything but he comp us some drinks. We will be back. Thank you Peter for the pleasant experience tonight.

I love this place. They have great service and they are very efficient. The food is amazing and very well priced. I have tried multiple locations of pho Saigon this one is my favorite our of all of them!

Recently moved here from Hawaii and needed to find a pho place. This place is great! They give big portions that are sure to fill you up with reasonable prices! Customer service is normally on point as I can only recall on time of mediocre service. Highly recommend this place!

Maybe it's because it just opened but my chicken was like super over cooked to the point that some part I couldn't even eat. I got the red rice with the whole hen. And I couldn't eat the flap part or some of the outside part of the whole chicken cause it's overcooked to the point that it's hard. And then my rice .. I usually love the red rice but it was so stale & just not easy to eat.
The pho soup on the other hand is pretty descent. Overall, I would like to come back maybe when they're not training anymore or something cause I couldn't even finish my food :(

Good food, but awful service and the prices are higher than similar places. We were ignored by the staff consistently and even after literally waiving at several people who made eye contact still no acknowledgment. 
The staff members, while inattentive, were also dressed in clothes that looked unwashed.

Food: very good
Service: very good, fast
Parking: lots
Inside : very spacious, 10 booths, 8 four tops, clean bright, 4 big screen TV playing sport. I have my fav booth that has a plug for my phone **smiles**
I have been here about 6 times now. Always half to to full odds customers. Price is reasonable.

I'm so happy they put a pho place in this plaza!! It's so close to my house & a very convenient location for having lunch after the gym or after grocery shopping! 

I've only ordered takeout but both times were really good. I've tried different things on the menu like the vermicelli, bun bo hue, beef ball soup, & some rice dishes. All were very good. 

The only reason this place lost a star is because once when I went, there was a bunch of homeless people hanging out on the side corner. Didn't look too good. But it was the 1st time I went & since then there hasn't been anymore. 
:-)

Introduction:
I tried to come here at least once a week. The food is outstanding and so is the service.

Quality: 5/5
I usually have the #22 large bowl Pho. I seemed to never finish it, but it's so good that the small is not enough.

Customer Service: 5/5
Definitely awesome, the waiter and Waitresses are cordial and on point.  Usually, you don't get these type of services at a Pho restaurant.

Quantity: 5/5
My gosh, they are super generous with their meat portions. No matter what you order, it's guaranteed that you will have enough food to fulfill your belly.

Cleanliness: 5/5
Squeaky clean.  Again, another unusual experience you will have at a Pho restaurant. In a good way of course.

Atmosphere: 5/5
No matter how busy they are, everyone appeared to be organized and not running like a chicken with it's head cut off.

Tips: 
If you are like me, not a fan of the Ketchup fried rice, you can actually order regular fried rice. Which is super delicious.

I have been here few weeks and it's hit or miss.  Today, I was there for lunch and I ordered same pho each time I go there.  I can order small pho with extra noodles without extra charge which I learn it from one of the waitress who works there.  Unfortunately she wasn't working there today.  The waiter who took my order today saying he can't put extra noodles.  You have to order on the side for extra $2.00.  He didn't say it with smile either.  The food taste okay, but the service is not so good.

Great Vietnamese food. I've been to pretty much every pho restaurant in the neighborhood and these guys are the best bar none. The pho broth is deep and flavorful, and every other item I've had has been top notch. Do yourself a favor and stop in.
Best Pho I've had in the valley. Every location is fantastic and the food is always consistent. Friendly service as well, will be back again and again.

I really like the quality of the food here. For starters, the egg rolls are delicious here. I remember my first time they would give s free egg roll, I guess they don't do that anymore, nonetheless still delicious. I haven't tried the spring rolls at THIS location but I have at the other location so I know I won't be disappointed. 

The pho, the broth, the noodles are all just a perfect blend when you need to fill yourself with something delicious with that homemade feel. I usually get the meat on the side, so I can watch the steamy broth cook the thin slices of beef. I LOVE this soup! Seriously, I absolutely love the feeling of warm, spoonfuls of noodles, meat and broth. 

Another one to try, the beef stew. It is served with a warm baguette. That is definitely a nice filler upper! 

If you're not a soup or noodle guy, they also serve rice plates. The thit muons is by far one of the best Vietnamese plates  in the city. 

The only downside is the wait can get hectic. I docked some stars because on the 3 occasions I have been, I've had a weird welcome (no greeting, no one to guide me to a table, so I sat myself only to be reseated?!) and a few inattentive servers. Other than that, the food is good, close to home & very well presented.
Service took awhile on a slow day and because of the repetitive "having to wait for different items I asked for", by the end of my meal I forgot to take the food I intended on bringing home lol.

By far the best place to get pho in Las Vegas. I have a 4 year old that at least once a week insist we go to eat here. I must say no matter if it is take out or eat in my wife and I have no problem with the request. We are very pleased there is now a location on are side of town as well.

The waiter/tress were very helpful! They knew when to come and the food was delicious!!!!!

P.S. The food looked so yummy we just dove in! No picture!

We came here 2 weeks after they opened.  Hoping this would be our pho spot on this side of town.  I was debating on their egg rolls for our appetizer, but didn't end up ordering it.  Since they're still launching their grand opening month, they offered us complimentary egg rolls.  I wasn't impress with them.  It wasn't so crispy and tasty.  It was more soft and overcooked.  We all ordered pho.  The pho broth here was more on the bland side or I would call it Americanize.  We definitely not craving it or anything.   

I prefer their location off Lindell and Spring Mountain better, even though the service isn't as good as this one.  I haven't been to the one off Eastern yet, from the reviews, it might be the one to try if I'm over in that area.

Same recipe...but different cooks makes the difference.

This pho place is close to my house. I'm so glad I have a good pho place near by. Their spring rolls are delicious! I'm not a vegetarian and their veggie spring rolls are a must try! I was surprised how good they actually were. Their broth is pretty consistent in a good way. I usually get the combination pho and the fried egg rolls as well. I haven't been disappointed in any of those dishes and will continue to come here. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the older Asian lady is kind of rude other than that everything else has been great.

This is the best Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  I love the "banh canh Saigon" and "bun cha Hanoi".  The food tasted so fresh and the staff was so attentive. The owner even gave us a free sample of milk tea...so delicious!

Better than the other place. 
Just kidding.  
It's good pho for what's around this side of town. 
Most definitely will come back when I'm craving pho. 
Ordered a number 21. Broth was awesome!

I had to bring my review to 5 stars for the sheer fact that I return here so often. It gets my weekly dosage of Vietnamese out of the way and I actually enjoy coming back.

I have tried many items and I plan to try them all.

Good service, decent pho. If you're around the area, try it out. They have a nice selection of offerings.

I stopped in Pho Saigon 8 for a quick bite during lunch.  They're located right off Rainbow and 215 and have plenty of parking.  

I know some of the reviews mentioned issues with service quality and speed, but my experience was pretty good all the way through.

I was greeted and seated right away.  The server immediately said that he would bring water over and to take a look if I wanted any other beverages.

I always go for the house special when I get pho.  I like the "everything combo".  They didn't explicitly list out such and item on the menu.  I asked my server if they had a house special and he said "I got you" without hesitation.  It was really nice to just be taken care of and let the kitchen make something up for me.

My combo pho came out delicious.  The "large size" serving was appropriate and they definitely do fill it up.  My only complaint is that I wished they had more variety of meats in my special combo.  The best part of this experience was that I was charged the regular 9.99 rate for my special order.  That was really nice of them.

Great customer service and delicious pho located in this side of town. My boyfriend and I have come in a few times (dining in and ordering take out) and they have always been consistent with their service and delicious Vietnamese dishes. We ordered take out tonight which was extremely fast. It only took about 15-20 minutes. We both ordered pho and egg rolls as an appetizer. Everything was made fresh to order. We especially loved how everything was hot even when bringing it home. Best part was that they also included all the veggies (like bean sprouts, basil, cilantro, etc) and different sauces (like hoisin, chili, and sriracha) to put in our pho. It definitely hit the spot since it's been really cold out. We will be back for sure.

Hello to location number 3! Can you say convenient? Thank you for coming to the southwest! This restaurant is located right off of the freeway on 215 and Rainbow across from the Walmart shopping center in the 7-Eleven plaza. Inside is spacious and clean with plenty of parking out front. Service was good. Everyone was very attentive and our waters were never less than half full. Unlike the other pho restaurants the soup spoons and chopsticks are not left at the table. So if you accidentally drop one be ready to wave down a server for another one lol

Banh Canh Saigon - BEST in Vegas!! This is what I come here for always. I love the flavor and thickness of the broth with the long tapioca noodles. Bowl is loaded with straw mushrooms, shrimp, pork, and pork blood. My favorite! Will not disappoint. 

Pho Dac Biet - Good! Their broth is nice and flavorful. Definitely one of the better pho broths in Vegas.

Cha Gio - Perfectly seasoned inside. Served hot and crispy with fresh veggies and pickled carrots/radishes for you to lettuce wrap it with. Comes with nuoc mam for you to dip it in. TIP: If you want your eggrolls / appetizers to come out first make sure you tell your server that. If not the entrees will come out first.

Goi Cuon - Good

If you're looking for good pho in the southwest this is the place to be. Spacious, clean, and quick service. They have comfortable booths with like 6 big screen TVs hanging up all over the restaurant for you to watch while you eat. Will definitely be back soon for my Banh Canh Saigon fix.
Amazing food, service and atmosphere! Very clean and am so glad I got to stop by! Thank you so much for the amazing and fresh pho, coffee and spring rolls!!!!

I came here on Monday with my husband and his uncle. This was our first time coming as well as our last time. My husband ordered the banh canh tom cua gio heo (udon with shrimp, crab, and pork feet.) In the photo it looked so amazing! However when it came out, my husband swirled around the soup. No shrimp. No crab. And no pork feet. There was a thin slice of pork. My husband asked the server if he was given the right dish. The server responded that it was what he ordered. Hubby asked why there was no shrimp or crab or pork feet. The server said that the crab was broken up in the soup so it was not easy to see and the thin slice of pork was the pork feet slice because they don't give out the bones. As for the shrimp, there truly wasn't any shrimp so the server came with a seperate bowl with shrimp for him. It really didn't taste good. We are a bit picky with Vietnamese food, so we decided to never return.

I'm so happy this location opened just less than 5 minutes away from my house! The pho always exceed my expectation and as a promo for this new location, they're offering a free egg roll per entree purchase. Staff was very friendly and service was good. I love the fact that this location has TVs also!

My friends and I visited this place twice for our Vegas trip  and both times the Pho was great. Not sure if it is for a limited time but, when you come in and order, they give you free egg rolls...plus!!!

I came here for the first time during dinner time and they weren't busy at all. There were probably 5 tables including us so we got greeted and seated right away. As we sat down our server was so quick to bring us our forks/ napkins, and waters. I'm amazed. The environment is beautiful and spacious. Within literally 4 minutes our server took our order, to me that's pretty quick and efficient. I ordered a large beef pho with brisket only. They don't have the brisket only option on the menu but my server was more than willing to accommodate me in what I wanted. My fiancè ordered the Sliced Grilled Pork with Egg Roll & steamed rice. 

We waited less than 10 minutes for our food and at the food window it looked like there was a manager overseeing the food being taken out so when my pho came out he asked the cook why is there so little meat and my server intervened to explain to him that I only wanted brisket. I really appreciated that a lot, the manager ensured my order was going out accurately. Then when it came to my fiancè's bowl it was semi-correct, instead of the steamed rice like he wanted they gave him rice noodles. We didn't say anything just because I'm that type of customer to accept what is given if it's a tedious mistake such as rice noodles instead of steamed rice. No biggie, the vermicelli was good anyway! Our total check was $22 with tax but without tip so it isn't bad for two people. This is a good late night pho place that remains open until 11pm so if you don't want to travel all the way to China town you have this place on Rainbow.
I like Pho here. Maybe MSG not add in, but delicious here and clean here. I love the food.

This is by far my favorite pho spot in Vegas! I love the fact that they have vegetable broth which is my favorite I've had! Not many pho restaurants have vegetable broth either. I typically get the vegetable and tofu pho which is always delicious and hits the spot. I have this place like 2x a week. The staff is always friendly for the most part. This is my go to and love that it's conveniently close to my house! 10/10 reccomend!!

Servers sucks there I had  to ask for napkins, forks and spoons. I paid for a large bowl and 2 small bowls, the large bowl had the same amount of noodles as the small bowl. Disappointing. Going back to Annie Pho. Sorry not sorry!

Definitely not the best pho I've had. Bowls were small compared to other places and priced higher. The Brother was not that flavorful and it wasn't as hot as it should be. The egg roll was thin and lacked flavor. The staff was ok. Not that helpful and the owner just stood at the register without a smile. 

I do have to say that their chicken and egg fried rice was good but would I come back? Most likely not.

There's no pho in summerlin so i google maps this place and although not the closest location this is a MUST TRY. so bomb. So lit. I loved everything about my vermicelli bowl. I got egg roll/pork/shrimp. My boyfriend got seafood pho and loved it. The Thai tea tastes authentic so that's another plus. Definitely would recommend & come back.

I used to go to their Eastern location a lot with my family when I still lived on that side of town. And now that it's opened on the Southwest, I wouldn't have to travel to Chinatown or the Southeast for pho anymore!

The place is super clean when we were there. Utensils aren't at the tables like they normally are for a pho place. The server brings you the utensils after you order.

I either like to order pho tai, which is pho with rare steak, or a pho tai bo vien, which is pho with rare steak and meatballs. You are able to either get a large bowl or small bowl and they're usually $1 difference. When I went with my husband one night, I was so hungry that I ordered a large bowl of pho while he ordered a small bowl. When they came with our food, they gave me his small bowl thinking it was mine. Hahahaha. 

I love pho because most places have piping hot soup and if they don't, they're horrible. And the best thing about Pho Saigon 8 is that their broth is actually very decent! It's always consistent whenever I go to the Eastern location and I imagine the Rainbow location would be the same. The broth isn't watered down or overly salty. It's not sweet either! Yes, there are pho places where their broth is sweet.  

Also, if the broth sucks, I typically pour a gallon of sriracha into it but here I don't! 

The prices are a bit higher than most other pho places but not by a lot. If you're hungry, always get the large one! 

Also, their egg rolls are pretty good too :) If pho doesn't fill you up, get an order of their egg rolls!

Cheap & quick service. Solid place for Pho Dac biet & Bun Bo Hue, they are not skimpy on their serving of beef. This is one of their better locations, especially better than the one on spring mountain. I do recommend getting a side of their egg rolls. This is our place to go on a Sunday. Not too crowded either.

Feeling hung over so stopped in at new pho place for a to go order.  Place was very clean neat and new.  Was welcomed by a nice lady, who took my to go order and even offered me cold water while I waited.  About 5 minutes later, she brought my to go order, very neatly packaged!  Raw beef slices were even bagged seperate!  Still steaming hot when I got home, flavor is excellent, good traditional broth, healthy portions of meat in both the chicken and beef pho.  Meat is tender and everything was perfect.  This is my new go to pho place close to home!

Impeccable service.  Delicious pho and spring rolls.  Quick, clean spot for lunch.  It was super busy when we walked in but they had a table waiting for us. By the time we were done the lunch rush was over. Thai tea was great.

Already ate here at least 10 times.  Its the best Pho place i have tried in Vegas,
It actually reminded me more of food in Garden Grove CA.
The quality has been pretty consistent.
The place is clean, and the service is good.
The number #78 is super bomb. The 215 and rainbow location is very nice and seems nicer than the others. The crispy eggroll is a must!

Very clean and VERY quick & friendly service.  For some reason I just don't feel like it hit the spot!  I live SW and I think if still drive to Spring Mountain for PHO.  I'm going to give it a chance and try some other things on the menu first though!!!

Compared to other pho places, this place isn't that bad and I can see myself returning here. Although the place is fairly new, it's nice to see that it's clean inside and it's pretty spacious. I ordered #20 and it was actually loaded with meat which I was thankful for. The soup broth was a bit too oily for me but the noodles were cooked just right. It was not too hard but it also did not get too soft even after sitting in the soup for a bit.

This is our go to pho place since it's a convenient location for us.  The place appears clean and is extremely kid friendly.  The portion size is generous and the soup broth is flavorful.   The meat and the bean sprouts always seem fresh. I do leave a little thirsty....so I'm guessing there's some MSG in the broth.  The egg rolls are always hot and crispy, but sometimes a little inconsistent with the amount of pepper used.  I like that they always give us a bowl and scissors to help cut up food for our toddler.  The service is always fast, we can usually be in an out in less than 45 minutes.  This is the typical Asian establishment, if you need something, it's best to be proactive and ask.

Hands down my favorite pho place in Vegas! I had a couple go-to places for pho before but after Pho Saigon 8 opened, this is my only place to go in Southwest area.

Food is great! I always had meatball pho because it will come out safe everywhere I guess.. but their meatball itself is already different, it's more chewy and just a better grade quality I could taste. So I decided to try Bun Bo Hue as well, and I was impressed! 

The main reason I will return her is because if the quality of food they serve, cleanness, and presentation. The environment is always clean, and my vegetable plate for my noodles are always fresh, clean, crisp, and well organized on the plate. Service was welcoming and friendly. Although they are not 'great service' like fancy restaurant, but among Vietnamese restaurant I think they are fast, hardworking, and knowledgeable.

Although for pho restaurant it's a about $1-$2 more expensive than some places, but I think it's totally worth it if they continue to provide this quality of food, environment, and service.

I haven't even eaten the food yet, but I'm with my 83 year old dad while pushing my sick mom in a wheelchair.  One of the older female waitresses was walking in at the same time as us and got to the door before we did.  She looked right at me, then at my mom in her wheelchair, opened the door and let the door close in my face.  What a BITCH!  Nice job at making my experience horrible before even eating the food.

This is by far the best Pho in town. They have another location I go to but took about 30 min to get there. Glad they opened one on my side of town. I always get the combination pho #18. Their food is pretty consistent with their other locations.

I would not recommend coming to this place solely based on the service. The soup itself was great when they don't mess up your order that is. What I called to speak them about my to-go order being messed up the person I spoke to stated he would take care of it no problem. Then when I showed up he wants me to pay for another one with a promise that they will get it right. That makes no sense then argued that I read the menu wrong. I repeated my orders several times which you confirm by repeating back to me so I don't know how I can miss read the menu when it was a special order. To argue like that and not care about customer service just turns you off to a location. I should have been concern during my initial order when he cared more about being on his phone then dealing with the customer. I would not recommend coming to this place. 

 Funny how the person responding to my review wasn't even there. This has nothing to do with getting anything for free. This is the point I was trying to make they would rather argue with their customers than listen to them.  Terrible terrible terrible. If they would have stopped arguing and actually listen they would understand or hear the point that I was trying to make.
Very disappointed in portion size , left still hungry . Service ok. Taste ok not great.

I came in around 2 for lunch on a Thursday and luckily it wasn't too busy so I was seated right away. I ordered the nem nuong spring rolls but they gave me the regular ones with shrimp instead. I was on a time limit so just ate it anyways. For my main entree I ordered the Saigon  banh canh  and it was just OK. I've had better and it was a lot of soup and not much meat. Also, no one followed up with me to see how everything was so customer service was lacking a bit.

This Pho place is my top 2 pho places in Vegas and you don't know how excited I am that there is a new location and that it is closer to my home than going to the one located on Spring Mountain in Chinatown. They have great tasting broths and other options for you non soup people out there. I have pretty picky standards with pho broths as I had an awesome place I used to go too back home in Hawaii. 

But all I know it's yummy pho, good apps and south of 215. It is good for all us people who live south of the 215 and close to blue diamond. YUM.

Food tasted the same as the spring mountain location which was great! Server was great and friendly. The cashier should quit because he definitely has no personality nor customer service skills lol. Grumpy people should stay at home haha.
WOW! This place was way better than expected. The normal place I go to rates crap compared to Pho Saigon 8. No wonder it's always packed!

This place is awesome!!!  Who built this location? Looks nicer than any restaurant ive seen off of the strip. The contractor must of been really amazing.  

The food is so delicious and fresh. More importantly, the owners are really good people. Especially, the mother who is actually the boss.

Ill come here any day of the week...

I went here with my friend to eat a few weeks ago. The only other time I've been here is to pick up a to go order. 

Ok let's talk about ambience... it's a typical Vietnamese pho joint which gets busy at times! Ive ordered a couple of food items which wasn't so tasty but there are also ones I do enjoy. Such as the banh cuon its tasty but i wish their servings is a big bigger in size. If you order that alone you won't be full. The pho here is pretty good. The soda chanh muoi is kinda sweet but if you let them know they will adjust it to make it taste better for you. 

The service at this location varies depending on who you get as a server... some are good and some aren't. 

Overall this place is a typical vietnamese pho joint where you can go for some tasty foods... I will come back again.. but this place is nothing to rave about. Its average viet food.
seriously delicious and service was really great!!!! half off appetizers for happy hour!! bun cha hanoi and nem nuong did not disappoint
